Posts.Title: Just diagnosed March 19 2015 Rhiannon426 Rhiannon426

Posts.Content: Rhiannon426 wrote: I got my diagnosis on Thursday. I have stage 2 ductal breast cancer. I have a very strong family history of breast cancer. Aunt, Mother, Sister. They tested positive for BRAC2 gene, I tested negative. Now I have a different type of breast cancer. I have chosen to have a bi-lateral mastectomy with sentinel lymph node dissection on both sides to double check if it has spread. My surgery is booked for April 16th. I am in a fog, one minute I am overwhelmed, the next I am ok with it. My mother did survive, but my sister passed.....how do I tell my mother? Dx 3/19/2015, ILC, Right, 3cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/4 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Surgery 4/14/2015 Mastectomy: Left, Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left Chemotherapy 5/14/2015 AC + T (Taxol) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed March 19 2015 Rhiannon426 Rhiannon426

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2015 03:31PM Rhiannon426 wrote: I got through it thanks to Ativan and the wonderful staff at the hospital. I did get an IV put in so they could inject a dye for the end part of the MRI. I think the laying facedown makes it easier due to your face not being up against anything other than a face pillow. The only strange thing they did was they taped vitamin E capsules onto my nipples an where the cancer is. Next step surgery. That is next Thursday. Thank you all for your helpful advice and suggestions

Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2015 01:12PM Rhiannon426 wrote: I just got my appt for an MRI Tuesday march 31st. As well I have my first appt with the oncologist who specializes in genetics for April 7th. I do have claustrophobia so I'm not sure how well the MRI will go. The oncologist appt will hopefully give me more answers and give me a second opinion about what I should do. I guess I need to write a list of questions to take with me.
